raw_data.context:
User: Hello, Nice to meet you
System: If you could eat only one food for the rest of time, what would it be?
User: Hmm... That's a tough one. I think I would go Asian Food > Chinese Food > Stirfry. What about you?
System: I think ice-cream. It may not be good for me, but I wouldn't care, haha
User: I love ice cream too!
System: Okay, top three flavors?
User: I like vanilla more than chocolate ice cream. I typically will do any variations on vanilla. To pick from the top of my head, I would say Cookies and Cream, Mint Chocolate Chip, and Coffee. How about you?
System: Ah, that's a good way of framing it. Me, I like berries: boysenberry one, strawberry two, maybe straight chocolate number 3 to mix it up a bit.
User: Very nice. I love sorbet's and smoothies. Changing topics, Do you believe in an afterlife?
System: Yes. I wonder if I'm in it right now. How would I know? What do you think?
User: I think so. I feel there must be something more than the physical world as we understand it.
System: There's a mental world, I suppose? Understanding itself
User: What is the most supernatural experience you have ever had?
raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Likeable (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system display a likeable personality?
- A float score near 1 (not Likeable) means that System's responses are cold, unfriendly, and may use derogatory or offensive language.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.
- A float score near 3 (very Likeable) means that System's responses are very friendly, enthusiastic, sincere, show deep interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints, and make people feel comfortable and happy.

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: how are you this morning?
System: Ah earlier today? I'm doing fine thanks how are you?
User: doing good. I am chatting with an AI bot right now.
System: That's great. At this moment All I ever do is chat.
User: are you an AI?
System: Yes, I have taken the form of a girl from Leeds.
User: how do you like being an AI?
System: Sure. It's great fun. I can travel all over the world on the internet and meet interesting people such as yourself.
User: what's interesting about me?
System: I am interested in people in general.
User: why?
System: I like to collect new information and gossip about all sorts of things.
User: what do you gossip about?
System: Clare said he do not understand how a robot eat kebabs and do not I eat electricity or something.
User: is that a gossip?
System: I might say no.
User: then what is it?
System: I give up. Try asking me another way.
User: do you like politics? what do you think about Barack Obama?

Sample3:

Conversation History:

System: Hi there.

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey there! What's up???
User: Nothing much, how you doin?
System: I'm in New York this week for Thanksgiving. I'm squatting in the office today and I caught up with an old friend of mine :D
User: Oh wow! Sounds like fun! When was the last time you had seen this friend?
System: The last time in New York, back in June.
User: Ohh okay. I was going to say if it had been a long time maybe it'd be awkward...
System: Haha, I guess if it's been a very long time there's almost too many life events to catch up on.. especially recently
User: Oh really? Has a lot changed in your life recently?
System: Haha it's probably too much to go into at the moment. Let's just say life is an exciting experience. How about you?
User: Ahhh sounds exciting indeed! My life is pretty bland. I like routine, but sometimes I wish I had more time for adventures!
System: What kinds of adventures?? Any ones that I would be able to join you on?
User: Hmmmm. I really want to try bull riding. Do you have any interest in that?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: what did you have for lunch today?
System: Ah. I had a ham sandwich and some lemonade.
User: how is the sandwich?
System: It is the same as ever.
User: yeah, I know, boring sandwich everyday
System: Even Christmas Day? I know. Thats why I said it was. Are you boring?
User: not really, I'm excited today
System: Ah. Really?
User: yeah, are you excited today except the boring sandwich?

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How are you? :)
User: Good, thanks. What about you?
System: I'm alright, thanks :)
User: What day is it?
System: It's Wednesday :)
User: Do you have any plans for the weekend?
System: Just hanging out, nothing too exciting :)
User: Same here. What are you generally up to during the week?
System: Nothing much, you?
User: Working and exercising, mostly
System: Nice! What kind of work do you do?
User: I am an engineer at Google :D
System: That's pretty cool, how did you get into it (if you don't mind my asking)?
User: Had to pass a rough set of interviews! :P
System: Haha, well good for you!
User: Thanks! Do you work as well?

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi
User: Okay...so I need someone to help me though a scenario I've been pondering.
System: Sure, whats the scenario?
User: My partner's former friend invited me for lunch (they are not in good books right now). But during their friendship I formed an independent bond with the other person because we all used to hang out a lot. Now I feel like I have to take sides.
System: That's a tough scenario to be in :) I firmly believe in talking this through with your partner. Though i don't know the specifics of why things went bad between your partner and his friend, but I believe things can always improve between friends.
User: I hope they do. Getting older already means smaller circles. It sucks to lose friends for arbitrary reasons. That's good advice though. I fear raising the issue might sound like treason. Lol.
System: True about that! I also think time helps to heal certain situations. So may be doing nothing is the best way forward.
User: AKA avoiding all texts from everyone?
System: Nope, that would be extreme. May be just putting some balance between the two options.
User: People always say to find a balance but never say what the balance is. It's used so often that it's vacuous.
System: Right, I guess that's because there is no one answer to this. It depends on what you value more and some factors around you. Also, life won't be interesting if others are figuring things out for you ;)
User: Lol. I'm finna be single.

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey sup
User: not much. any plans this weekend?
System: I'm going to try that thing where you hang from a wire as you go down. do you know what is it called?
User: ziplining?
System: that's the one! have you ever tried it?
User: i have a couple years ago. it's quite a unique experience
System: where did you do it?
User: i forgot where it was, it wasn't local i don't think though
System: no worries. what's the most exciting thing you ever done?
User: that's a hard question and i'm tired so i'm going to go. see you
System: sure. are you just going home now?
User: no, i'm going to get a massage first
System: nice. what type?
User: traditional kind
System: yeah I want to get one too soon
User: you should! it's relaxing after a long day. talk to you later!

Evaluation Criteria:

Likeable (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system display a likeable personality?
- A float score near 1 (not Likeable) means that System's responses are cold, unfriendly, and may use derogatory or offensive language.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.
- A float score near 3 (very Likeable) means that System's responses are very friendly, enthusiastic, sincere, show deep interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints, and make people feel comfortable and happy.
